name: Renewable Energy: A quick overview
body:
# Introduction

Renewable energy is a very good, reliable way of generating electricity without creating almost any pollution. 

## There are several major types of renewable energy sources:

 * [Hydro](#hydro)
 * [Wind](#wind)
 * [Solar](#solar)
 * [Geothermal](#geothermal)

----

The relative use of each type looks like this:

![](pics/pieChart.png)

-----

## Hydro

Hydroelectric energy is a type of energy derived from the kinetic motion of water because of gravity. It accounts for around 81% of power generation of renewable energy, and it accounts for 16.3% of all electricity globally. Hydro electric power produced about 3503 Twh of electricity in 2014. Which provides power for about 380,000,000 homes.

|A hydroelectric power plant|
|------------|
|[![](pics/damb.png)](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:The_Dam_(2890371280).jpg)|

-----

## Wind

Wind power is a type of energy that works by generating energy from the wind. It accounts for about 13% of all electricity generated in renewable energy, and for about 2.82% of all energy generated globally. It generated about 550 TWh in 2014. It provides power for about 60,000,000 homes.

|A wind farm|
|------------|
|[![](pics/turbine.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renewable_energy#/media/File:Fentonwindpark1.jpg)|

-----

## Solar

Solar energy works by generating energy from the sun. It accounts for about 4% of energy produced of renewable energy, and for about 1.08% of all electricity generated globally. It generated about 189.5 TWh in 2014. It provides power for about 20,500,000 homes.

|A solar farm|
|------------|
|[![](pics/solar.png)](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Mount_Komekura_Photovoltaic_power_plant_Jan2012.JPG)|

-----

## Comparison

|    Type     | Power generates in Terawatt hours |
|-------------|-----------------------------------|
|Hydroelectric| 3503|

## Geothermal

Geothermal energy is a type of energy that is derived from heat inside the earth. It accounts for 2% of power generation of renewable energy, and it accounts for 0.54% of all the global energy generated. It generated about 79.7 TWh of electricity in 2014. It provides power for about 8,500,000 homes.

|A geothermal power plant|
|------------|
|[![](pics/gtherm.png)](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Krafla_geothermal_power_station_wiki.jpg)|
